Class GameGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.logic.GameGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class GameGrid
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Abstract representation of a minegrid.
    Author:
    Saskeli

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameGrid

        public GameGrid(int width,
                int height,
                int mines)
        Abstract representation of a minegrid.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the grid to be created
        height - the hight of the grid to be created
        mines - the desired mine count

      • GameGrid

        public GameGrid(Tile[][] tiles)
        Abstract representation of a minegrid.
        Parameters:
        tiles - a square array of tiles.

      • GameGrid

        public GameGrid(GameType gameType)
        Abstract representation of a minegrid. Note: With the CUSTOM game type. A HARD game will be started instead.
        Parameters:
        gameType - the type of game to create

    • Method Detail

      • getGameType

        public GameType getGameType()

      • getValue

        public int getValue(Coordinate coord)
        get the number of mines that are known to be adjacent to the given coordinate
        Parameters:
        coord - the coodinate to check around
        Returns:
        0 if the game has not started, 9 if the tile is a mine, and 0-8 otherwise.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Coordinate coord)
        Check if a given coordinate is valid. I.e. that the coordinate is withing the curren game.
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordinate to check
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate is on the grid.

      • hasMine

        public boolean hasMine(Coordinate coord)
        Check if there is a mine at a given coordiante.
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordinate to check
        Returns:
        true if there is a mine at the given coordinate

      • clear

        public boolean clear(Coordinate coord)
        Clears the tile at the given coordinate. Esentially clicks the tile.
        Parameters:
        coord - the oordinate to clear
        Returns:
        false if the cleared tile was a mine

      • addMinesToSpecials

        public void addMinesToSpecials(int minesToAdd,
                               Coordinate aroundCoord)
        Used to populate squares around the initially cleared square on game start if there are more mines than initially populated.
        Parameters:
        minesToAdd - the number of mines to add
        aroundCoord - the coordinate to leave clear

      • clearMines

        public void clearMines()
        Sets the state of all tiles with mines to cleared. Usefull for clearing all mines on game over.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • leftToClear

        public int leftToClear()
        Get the number of tiles left to clear. I.e. tiles that are not cleared and are not mines.
        Returns:
        the number of tiles left to clear

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of the game grid

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of the game grid

      • isCleared

        public boolean isCleared(Coordinate coord)
        Check wether the tile at the specified coordinate is cleared.
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordinate to check
        Returns:
        true if the tile at the specified coordinate is cleared

      • getMines

        public int getMines()
        Returns:
        the number of mines specified by the constructor of this GameGrid

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged(Coordinate coordinate)
        Check if the tile at the specified coordinate is flagged.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified tile is flagged

      • toggleFlag

        public void toggleFlag(Coordinate coordinate)
        Toggles the flag of the tile at the specified coordinate
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate for the tile to toggle

      • clearSurrounding

        public void clearSurrounding(Coordinate coordinate)
        Clears the non-flagged tiles around the specified coordinate if the value of the tile specified by the coordinate equals the number of flags adjacent to the tile.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to clear around
